title: Real-world area and circumference
prompt:
The circus has several large circle tents. Each has a
circumference of approximately 188.4 feet. The radius

of the tent must then be ![dropdown:radius] ft and the

area under the tent must be ![dropdown:area] ft2.

(Use π=3.14)
hint: Sketch a diagram of the situation to help you understand it.
feedback:
In this question you are given the circumference of a circle and are asked to find the radius and then the area of the circle. The formula for circumference is  <math>
<mrow>
 <mi>C</mi>
 <mo>=</mo>
 <mn>2</mn>
 <mi>π</mi>
 <mi>r</mi>
</mrow>
</math>
. To find the radius you must solve for <math>
<mrow>
 <mi>r</mi>
</mrow>
</math>
.
</br>
<math>
<mrow>
<mi>r</mi>
 <mo>=</mo>
 <mfrac linethickness="1">
  <mn>C</mn>
  <mrow>
   <mn>2</mn>
   <mi>π</mi>
  </mrow>
 </mfrac>
</mrow>
</math>
<math>
</math>
<math>
<mrow>
 <mo>=</mo>
 <mfrac linethickness="1">
  <mn>188.4</mn>
  <mrow>
   <mn>2</mn>
   <mi>π</mi>
  </mrow>
 </mfrac>
 <mo>≈</mo>
 <mn>30</mn>
</mrow>
</math>
. Once you have found the length of the radius, you can calculate the area with the formula 
<math>
<mrow>
 <mi>A</mi>
 <mo>=</mo>
 <mi>π</mi>
 <msup>
  <mi>r</mi>
  <mn>2</mn>
 </msup>
 <mo>=</mo>
 <mi>π</mi>
 <mo>⋅</mo>
 <mn>3</mn>
 <msup>
  <mn>0</mn>
  <mn>2</mn>
 </msup>
 <mo>=</mo>
 <mn>2,826</mn>
</mrow>
</math>
.
